result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Donald Duke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and child care

miscConds.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA, during term of probation. Any unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment with tax intercept.
- Restitution set at $0.
- No further violations of the law.
- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Donald Duke

records.addlTxt:
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.

As to Count 1 as amended: Defendant ordered to serve 10 days in the House of Correction, Huber privileges for work and child car. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

- No further violations of the law.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Maintain employment. 
- 10 hours community service. 
- Cognitive behavioral therapy course.
- Restitution set at $0.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Any unpaid amount to convert to civil judgment with tax intercept.

Defendant has 48 hours to report for DNA swab. 

Court advises defendant of appeals rights.

Defendant Gary Donald Duke in court, appearing pro se.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
On state's motion, Court ordered charge AMENDED to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stats. sec. 947.01, a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Gary Donald Duke in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defendant appears in court pro se.  Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel. Court orders case set for another status. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary Donald Duke in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gary Donald Duke appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Defendant has not retained private counsel. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant may want to submit waiver of right to attorney at the next court date.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15
  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any Woodmans Food Market.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gary Donald Duke in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
